Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Sharon P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a perfect location, right by the Trevi fountain, a very central location, loved the rooftop restaurant overlooking the fountain, the staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was lovely and the room was very clean and comforatble, would definitely return +++++

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sineaddonnelly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the historical centre of Rome. All of the major tourist attractions are within short walking distance. Our hotel room was spotlessly clean, spacious, tastefully decorated, air conditioned and quiet. The bathroom was large and well stocked with good quality towels and toiletries. The breakfast area is beautiful - a terrace overlooking the trevi fountain! Breakfast is a self service buffet with plenty of hot and cold foods to choose from. What really made our stay at this hotel so nice was the staff - they were extremely friendly, polite and helpful. They carried out their work in a professional, efficient and unobtrusive way but were always there to offer assistance if needed. They are a really great asset to this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the centre of things - the sights, atmosphere etc. I will definately stay here again whren I return to Rome. .

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Nan555
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and our very first experience with an Italian hotel. Imagine as we step out of the taxi, we are greeted at the door and our luggage is whisked up the stairs. As we walk into the lobby we are welcomed by the nicest, friendliest man at the front desk. I believe his name was Salvo. He greeted us by name!! He spoke impeccable English, pulled out a map and showed us where everything was. The rest of the staff that we encountered during our stay were equally helpful if not as memorable. The room was nice, the bed was comfortable, we had free wifi. For breakfast they served a free buffet in their breakfast room. Again, the staff was very friendly and the food was good. I have only one complaint about the hotel and that was the elevator. It stopped between floors so that you still had to go down a flight of stairs to get to your room. After one day in Rome, the arthritis in my knee was pretty bad and I didn't really want to do the stairs but didn't have a choice. If you have any mobility problems, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fountain of Youth”
Reviews.Author: gibsonchop
Reviews.Content: Elegant, fantastic location and right in the center where the Trevi fountain flows! We had a view of part of the fountain and it was neat to see the crowds in the day then to wake up and open the shutters to fresh air without a soul in site at 8 A.M....It was raining too but still a neat site. The location is great and within walking distance to the Pantheon, Capuchin Crypt, Spanish Steps and depending how far your legs can go the Colosseum. Great location to catch the metro and get off at all the sites too. We utilized it all and really loved the energy that came with the hotel and the surroundings. One drawback, we live in Naples, and drove our car up and ended up leaving it in a parking lot close to the Colosseum because the parking in the area is pretty non-existent. We did notice parking in the Spanish Steps area but it was Carnevale weekend and we just didn't feel like messing with it......So parking is not really there..... Our shower was full of jets and the pressure was great!!!! We were surprised at the size of the room. Most hotel rooms in Europe are quite small. Oh they also offer an in room coffee and tea maker....That is something very rare in Italy!!! Breakfast buffet was top notch!!! Overall a great hotel that brought out our fountain of youth!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Earthling70_10
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, practically all Rome highlights are within walking distance, maybe with the exception of the Vatican. Our room was tiny, and rather dark, but at least the mattress was comfortable. Any assistance needed was perfectly provided by the helpful staff. It also provides one of the most decent breakfasts I've had anywhere in Italy, a country which doesn't really do breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: MARK H
Reviews.Content: The relais Fontana Di Trevi Hotel is 10yds from the Tevi Fountain and some rooms overlook the fountain. We had a triple room in the Annex which is about 50yds up the street from the main hotel. The room was well furnished and very comfortable. Everything a 4 * hotel should be. We stayed on a Bed and Breakfast basis and the Breakfast was served on the 3rd floor of the main hotel, overlooking the Trevi Fountain. Buffet style breakfast with hot and cold options. Throughout our stay the staff on reception and in the Breakfast room were most helpful and polite. The Hotel is situated next to the Trevi Fountain, which is an ideal position for visiting all the Historic sites of Rome and the Vatican City. During our stay we had no need to travel by Taxi or Bus as it was so easy to walk to any location. Overall - Excellent hotel and Superb Location

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LanaGorn
Reviews.Content: Amazing location to explore Rome for the first time. We fell in love with Fontana Di Trevi and enjoyed watching it during different hours - early in the mowning, when it's cleaned - from the patio upstairs; late at night - before we go to bed. The personnel is veru friendly, they offer pick-up and ride back to the airport. Good breakfast. Clean rooms. Nice decor. What else you need in Rome - when you are away all day exploring the history!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't get better”
Reviews.Author: SallyBerkshire
Reviews.Content: wow! wow! I would really reccommend this hotel,,what a fantastic location, right next to the Trevi Fountain, as 5min walk from Spanish Steps. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, I can't rate this hotel enough, our room was a really good size, and at first I thought it would be noisy as we were overlooking the front where the resturants and shops were, but once the shutters were pulled we never heard any noise from outside. Breakfast was buffet style and the staff greeted us by name, they all spoke english We could walk to most of the tourist attractions from this hotel, but we did catch the tube to The Vatican, fantastic location, we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Angie R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located across the lane way to the Trevi Fountain. Breakfast is on the balcony overlooking the fountain - we went and looked at the area but we didn't eat there. We were upgraded to a 2 room, glad we were as we used one for our luggage. Rooms are very small - as I have found are most European hotel rooms. Very quiet, probably the most quiet hotel & nicest out of our whole trip so far. Very clean rooms. Our luggage was carried up to our room, small lift and only goes up a couple of flights. Very helpful staff, they assisted us with how to book our tickets to St Peters Basilica in advance and print the tickets for a small fee. Hotel includes Free Wifi that was very fast. This hotel came recommended and we weren't disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: ciba123
Reviews.Content: Don't go near this hotel. Upon arriving they sent us to apartments down the street from the hotel..they called this the annex. It had no elevator and were just plain dreary apartments for the price of a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMerrill
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered the best location in Rome! We were right across from the Trevi Fountain. Breakfast and drinks after six on the balcony overlooking the fountain was incredible. Salvo was incredible and took great care of us. Our luggage was carried up and down the stairs for us, our every request was granted with a positive attitude. I would definitely go back. Just don't get room 304. It was a noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Cairomac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The staff are friendly and helpful, it is in a fabulous location and the room was great. We stayed in the Attic room, nice room with a big terrace. Breakfast overlooking the fountain, wow!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa E
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Relais Fontana Di Trevi, was so much more than we were expecting. On arrival we were received with such a warm welcome with the staff offering us so much helpful information about staying in Rome. We stayed in the Annex for 2 nights then in the main building for the last two nights. The rooms were lovely in both, with big windows and balconies opening up to enjoy the exciting vibe of Trevi Fountain. Rooms are beautifully decorated and very, very clean and large given usual European standards. The breakfast in the morning was absolutely beautiful and fresh, not to mention the stunning location with the Trevi Fountain being the back drop to some amazing photos. The staff at this hotel is what made our trip, If I could name them all I would, but a big thank you must go to Salvatore who was so attentive to all our needs and requirements. Having read the previous review it would appear to us that it must have been a different hotel. I will say the shower was a little on the small side but - thats Europe isnt it?? Thank you again to all the wonderful staff who made our stay at Trevi so special from Salvatore to the guy on the desk - John from Argentina ??? to the boys in the breakfast room and rooftop bar at night nothing was ever too much trouble. Also a massive thank you to the man who had to carry my 35kg bag up and down those stairs - dont know how you did it. Looking forward to returning to Relais Fontana Di Trevi and would have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any prospective guests, you will LOVE IT and I would consider myself quite fussy!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel, great view of Trevi fountain”
Reviews.Author: Tracy J
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely, romantic stay here for 3 nights. Perfect for couples and in an ideal, central location. We walked everywhere! We had a big, spacious room overlooking the Trevi fountain, beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: inakiMakati
Reviews.Content: Location of this was great and our room was spacious and clean. Coffee and breakfast was good. I would recommend this place. Inaki

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and not much comfort”
Reviews.Author: fantarla
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is spectacular, you are a stone's throw away from the front of the Trevi fountain. But the view does not make up for the uncomfortable, claustrophobic, tiny rooms, lobby, and breakfast area. Shower was so small that if you dropped the soap you could not bend over to pick it up. Barely room to put a suitcase. Breakfast was a disappointment, particularly as the morning waitress could not have been more unwelcoming. Visit the fountain, it's magnficent, but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Trevi Fountain view and roof top Romance”
Reviews.Author: NYCLobsterLuva
Reviews.Content: The Trevi Fountain. This is the single most romantic place in the world. Rooftop dining overlooking the Trevi Fountain. Enough said. This Hotel is perfect if you are staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “IN THE HEART OF TREVI!”
Reviews.Author: lisadgreat1
Reviews.Content: So, the place is immediately next to the Trevi Fountain. Our taxi driver wasn't sure about the address and couldn't go all the way to the entrance because of the narrow streets/crowds, etc. But, if you look at the pics from a directional standpoint, you can find it fairly easily. The beds were comfy. The room was spacious. It was what you would expect from an old world country. If you are looking for the Four Seasons, this isn't it. With this location, you probably won't spend much time in the room! I would definitely go back and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it once again”
Reviews.Author: gerri53
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from another wonderfull stay at this hotel can not rate it highly enough went with my mum this time around, the staff are lovely breakfast is good lovely veiws of the fountain, rooms are lovely would reccomend to anyone can not wait to go back and definatley stay here again

Reviews.Title: “WORTH STAYING”
Reviews.Author: mbutterfly1977
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a delicacy. I stayed here twice and I know that every time I will come back to Rome I will come back here too. I like it because of the beautiful, unique view, and location. Rooms are a bit small, but abundant breakfast table will recompense this small discomfort. There is a very good restaurant serving delicious grilled portabella mushrooms during the fall season (turn left from the hotel and it should be the second restaurant on your right before the Pantheon). We had a marvelous time both in Rome and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kangarian
Reviews.Content: I ordered limo pick-up through the hotel and was met by a lovely gentleman taxi driver who charged us less than the quoted amount. The ride to the hotel along the narrow, cobblestone streets into the crowd of tourists and people eating at tables outside the restaurants on the sides of the streets was quite an experience. The reception manager 'processed' our check-in like a factory, mass production line. The breakfast wait staff made up for it, particularly Dominick and Erik. They even remembered what drinks we had with our breakfast so the tea/coffee would be ready very promptly. They noticed our absence on the morning we skipped breakfast for an early departure to Pompeii. In a city where we didn't know anybody, such 'little' things add to our memories and the humanity of that place. Great coffee and great selection of food for breakfast. Delicious chocolate crepes. We had two rooms in the annex building. One was quite snug but the other down the end of the short hallway, was more luxurious. Both were equally comfortable. Good sound insulation as we couldn't hear anything from the busy streets downstairs. A lovely porter helped us with our luggage up the stairs. After having visited the various sites, we reckon we stayed in the best location. Being just about next to the Trevi fountain, we could visit the place anytime, like when the crowd was gone, to have the magic of that place all to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, recommendations!”
Reviews.Author: Apla
Reviews.Content: We had excellent four days in Rome in April 2011. Location is superb, breakfast location and quality is extraordinary. Staff service more than helpfull! Rome can be a bit hectic and tiring but when you come to this hotel for a short rest you feel like in heaven. There are many restaurants in close vicinity, attraction are all in walking distance (apart from Vatican and Foro Romano). We enjoyed just looking from the hotel window to the street and observed the life on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: antandruth
Reviews.Content: Fabulous boutique hotel, beautifully appointed rooms and sumptuous breakfast, a definite must to be enjoyed on the terrace overlooking the Trevi fountain. We stayed in the attic room with terrace, overlooking the roof tops of Rome was very romantic. Wonderfully located for exploring the city on foot with the metro not far for a trip further afield. Staff were warm and always helpful. Would love to return, it was so hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: luvyak
Reviews.Content: Imagine planning and saving for months to go on your dream vacation. Imagine you only have one day and night to spend in Rome so you arrange a tour that will provide you with the most comprehensive experience possible and you select a hotel that puts you right at the steps of the Trevi Fountain. Imagine the joy and childlike excitement you feel as the day your dream finally is going to come true. Then imagine the utter disappointment not only in your heart but visable on your daughter's face when you learn that due to bad weather we would miss our connecting flight and there was no other flight available for until the evening of the next day. I had my daughter contact both the tour company and hotel from the airport so that we could advise them our situation. The gentleman my daughter spoke with at the Relais Fontana Di Trevi advised her that it was 11:00pm their time and that we would need to call back in the morning and speak with a manager. Once we got home from the airport that night I followed up with an email and informed them I would call as we had been advised to do. I got up at 2:30AM our time in order to call and that gentleman indicated that there was no manager that worked on the weekend(it was Saturday) and that he saw where I had emailed so the manager would respond to my email on Monday, he told me to not call back. Of course no email came on Monday or Tuesday, etc. I sent another email simply asking that they please respond to my email, I understand having to have a policy but I remained hopeful that the manager, especially if the room had been rented out, would understand I could not control weather and would not charge my card. Needless to say I never heard back from anyone and I sent several other emails and today my credit card came in and it was charged, not a cheap room might I add. When I orginally booked the room they were quick to respond to the numerous emails I sent but I guess they are only interested in being helpful if it serves them. On a side note, the tour company(romeinlimo) responded and didn't charge my card. Should I ever get back to Rome I will use them but you can be assurred I will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved this location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy124
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated out 20th wedding anniversary here for 3 days before moving on to Tuscany. I loved this hotel because it was clean, the beds were comfortable and the location cannot be beat. They have clearly sound proofed the rooms because our room overlooked the Trevi Fountain and when the windows were closed it was like a sanctuary, very peaceful. I felt very safe walking by myself in this area and found it very charming and beautiful. The hotel manager gave good recommendations as to where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: MBroyhill
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at this hotel in order to see Rome before heading on a cruise. We chose to stay at the Annex, about a block away from the main hotel, and chose not to have breakfast included. We were very happy with our decision and would definitely stay there again and make those same choices. We saved about 30 Euro a night staying in the Annex and I think another 20 Euro not having breakfast. The Annex was nice and quiet and at night it was quaint with the street being lit up by candles. If we needed anything we could walk over to the hotel or call. It was actually nice being just a block off of the fountain and away from so many people (and the noise). One morning we had their breakfast and it was definitely a good value. However, we wanted to explore other options in the area. A TIP--Try the coffee bars. Stand up. It's cheaper than sitting down! One morning we had pastries and coffee for about 3 Euro each at a place about a block away and it was excellent. The location is perfect. We walked everywhere. Bring comfy shoes!! We walked to the Borghese Gallery (reservations required), Forum, Spanish Steps, Colossium, etc. The only place we took a subway was to the Vatican. Another TIP--Get the Roma Pass at the airport when you arrive in Terminal 3. It's 25 Euro and includes free public transportation and two entries (and after that reduced rates) into almost all of the sites. Obviously use the freebies on the most expensive tickets. You can also skip a lot of the lines. Oh, and download Rick Steves' many free podcasts on your ipod and you won't have to rent audio tours when you go places. If you ask, the hotel will arrange airport transportation. We paid 50 Euro total for a "limo service" which included a black Mercedes with black leather interior with a classic Italian looking (and musky smelling) driver in a nice suit. It was awesome! Easier and not much more than either a cab or public transport. He was waiting for us and was very friendly. The hotel also helped us out when our luggage didn't arrive when we did. Overall, one of the better hotels I've stayed in when considering value, location and service all combined. We would definitely stay there on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yr2la8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is categorized and named as a luxury hotel however it was only really above average (based on other experiences in european hotels) in our opinion. We had 2 rooms 1 for my husband and I and 1 for my mother. The location was great, it was within steps of the Trevi Fountain. Our overall Room #105 layout: larger than most we'd stayed in. no carpet, wood floors, 2 nightstands, 1 flat screen tv that was mounted on the wall, large closet and a desk. THe room was also right next to the housekeeping room so all night we heard the phone ringing and buzzing. Thin walls Mom's overall room layout: not large at all, the bed took up the whole room, it had a small closet and a desk with a tv on top of it. No window Our Bathroom: shower and bath area were extremely small but that was expected. The toliet was literally against the wall so you could not sit on it normally you had to side saddle it so to speak. It was quite funny. I had to go across the hall to use my Mom's restroom because it was ackward. (I had to take photo of this but wish I'd taken more of the room) Mom's Bathroom: Very roomy, almost as large as the rest of the room. even had a door that went out to some sort of patio. The patio was somewhat strange because it was just a large holding place for old stuff from the hotel. Kind of creepy. We were told by an older man at the desk on arrival we were "lucky" to have received such a great room and that he " didn't know how that happened" but we had a great view. That was ridiculous to say the least. The room had a window that overlooked the front of the hotel. If you turned your head to the left sharply you could see the Trevi fountain. You could hear all the action going on around the fountain and below all night. The facility is heated without controls in your room so it was often too warm for us and we wanted to open the window to get some fresh air however since there are many smokers in Italy and our room was right above a neighboring restaurant the smoke was overwhelming. Breakfast: powdered eggs, coffee, fruit, rolls, toast, yogurt, juice. some sort of meat that I didn't recognize. The staff were nice except for the older man we met upon arrival. Do NOT eat anywhere in the immediate area around this hotel, the food is poor and the prices are HIGH AND they rip you off. I'll be writting a review about one restaurant in particular. I took photos of this place to be sure people would recognize it. I would recommend this hotel to a friend because it is a nice location and overall it was average. Comparatively it was one of the better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “lovely room, great location, friendly and helpful staff, perfect for a weekend in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: nikkig1946
Reviews.Content: myself and my boyfriend stayed here based on the previous reviews and this hotel did not disappoint. we were upgraded on arrival to a larger room which was very comfortable and clean. it was spacious and the only negative comment i would have is it was very warm in the room and it was difficult to sleep at night. we did turn off the radiators! the breakfast was great but they could do with fresh coffee but the pastries and crepes were yum. all staff were very helpful and spoke english. our bags were brought to and from our room and maps were given upon arrival. the fountain is right out side the hotel door and what i loved was when we arrived back late at night it was finally quiet and if you were lucky you got the place to yourself. you are 5 minutes from the pantheon and the Piazza Navona. the colleseum is about a 15 minute walk away and the nearest metro is just up the road around 5 minutes walk. all in all i had a great stay and i would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Adjii
Reviews.Content: I remember searching trip advisor in the months leading to my trip with my boyfriend. I researched the perfect hotel for days. I came across Relais and noticed pretty good reviews and prices so we booked it. I am pretty sure I will go back there if I need a hotel in Rome in the future. For a standard bedroom, I paid 200 euro a night which is a great deal for being right in front of the Fontana Di Trevi and close walking distance to other sites. We got there early and the staff was cheerful and held our bags until our rooms were ready. They even helped out my now fiance get roses into the room the night he proposed to me at the Piazza di Spanga. We had a standard room and I found it to be charming and more spacious than I thought it would be. The bathroom was cute. It was a cross between antique marble with updated fixtures and soaps. We didn't have a view but we didn't mind. My sister and her husband were celebrating their 1 year anniversary so they splurged and got the room with the Trevi View. It was huge! The window was small but you can really sense the activity below but was still quiet at night. The world cup was going on and the staff helped us figure out how to plug in our computer to the tv. Now, for anyone that complains about the breakfast who isn't from Italy( I am Italian- American), Italians don't do breakfast the way we do in America, so I found their continental breakfast really lovely and suprising. For bars and restaurants, I'd reccomend you go to Campo dei Fiori or Piazza Navona. We ate at El Bric the night we got engaged and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: Lindamood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights - November 1, 2, 3, 4, 2010. The location is perfect. This place is within walking distance to everything. This is Europe, so the rooms are smaller and the bathrooms are very small. Hotel staff was great. The bed was comfortable and the a/c and heat worked perfect. The breakfast is horrible. Unfortunately so many Americans come to Rome and the hotel tries to accomodate. Therefore, the breakfast has been Americanized. I am proud to be an American, but I get really tired of how American people complain when they travel and expect everything to be the same way it would be staying at a 5 star hotel in the United States. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be perfectly located for our trip. We were able to walk to every attraction we wanted to see. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was also enjoyable. If you are a younger couple traveling with out children, and are planning on walking to the attractions in Rome, this would be the ideal hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location only”
Reviews.Author: Miltonboy101
Reviews.Content: One step out your door and you're at the Trevi Fountain. That's the good news and that's about it. You are paying for location! Other than that I can't say much else that's good. There is a breakfast room that overlooks the fountain but again that's location. Rooms are small, bathroom antiqued, AC did not work, open windows meant lots of noise. Staff was rather aloof and not all that helpful. Elevator accomodated 1 person and 2 bags. Lobby was small and narrow and the halls were dark. Swiched to Hotel Julia after 2 nights and was much happier not to mention the savings.

Reviews.Title: “not handicap or old people friendly”
Reviews.Author: HowdyYall83
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. Nice spacious rooms. Small bathroom. Very Clean. The staff was friendly. We quickly learned that when in Europe you don't ask for ice. They think this is a very strange request. The only problem we had were the steps. You had to climb two flights to the lobby. Then either go back one flight to the elevator or up one flight. When the elevator drops you off at your floor you either have to go up one flight or down one flight. you have to make one step up to the hallway. When in our room, from the room hallway, you had to take one step up to the bathroom, one step up to the bedroom. From our bedroom you had to take one step down from it to the spare room. Since my husband has problems with stairs, it made for problems. Would love to go back, but unless I get better knees will have to stay at some American type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location. Nice staff. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KNara
Reviews.Content: Had a tough time locating this hotel. Nobody seemed to recognize the street name. Once we got in though, experience was very good. Front desk people were helpful unlike the hotel that we stayed in Sorrento. Room was modern, clean and well decorated. Aside from its typical European size, it was all we could ask for. TV worked well with English channels. We chose not to pay the extra 50 euros for a fountain view room. If you want to see the fountain you just need to walk outside the hotel and go 50 feet. Besides, the street side rooms are bound to be busy since the fountain is popular till the wee hours of the morning with big crowds well past midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: suzsch
Reviews.Content: We would definitely go back to this hotel when in Rome again. The location was great - within walking distance of everything. It is steps away from the Trevi Fountain. Restaurants and shops everywhere! Our room had a balcony and we would stand on the balcony and just watch the crowds. The triple room was great - spacious for 3 people and a very large and modern bathroom. Very clean and maintained beautifully. We were on the 3rd floor and close to the restaurant. Buffet breakfast was superb and the restaurant beautiful. The people at the front desk were all nice and hospitable. Even though we were there at the top of the tourist season, it did not seem crowded - either at the hotel or in the city. The AC was great and even though we had a room facing the main street, there was no noise with the doors closed. The only possible problem would be there were steps to climb to get to the front desk. We had no problem but if you were not a 'step-climber', you might have trouble. The subway station was a few blocks away and we did use it to get to an 8 AM entry to the Vatican Museum, but we walked back. We loved this hotel and Rome and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cnomis
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel if you want something that little bit special, the rooms are spacious, the staff are brilliant especially the waiter Red he made our holiday, dine on the roof terrace restaurant overlooking the Trevi, you'll find although a little expensive this hotel is just what you are looking for

Reviews.Title: “Great location right next to Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: cpal0807
Reviews.Content: Dont let first impressions of the hotel entrance deter you. The hotel is situated in a very busy street lined with cafes and souvenir shops and bustling with tourists. Great atmosphere. Our tariff was for superior room including breakfast. The room was tastefully decorated and although the room was spacious enough, the bathroom was cramped. Room was clean with comfortable bed. Staff were extremely helpful with sightseeing options. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the fountain was a terrific experience and was good value. Situated in a great location within easy walking distance to most attractions. Have no hesitation in recommending

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel in a Perfect Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: xj0r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Fontana Di Trevi right at the end of our Honeymoon. It was the perfect ending to a perfect holiday! The hotel was very comfortable, and we were lucky to have been upgraded in our room to one that had a view (albeit small) of the Trevi Fountain. Despite being so close to the Fountain you could close up the windows and it wasn't overly noisy either. The restaurant on top of the hotel was the highlight, watching the throngs of people at the fountain throwing coins in, eating gelati and generally having a great time. The meals were fantastic and the waiter, Red, was a great laugh every time we were up there. The hotel was in a prime location for us to explore the sights of Rome, very central with most attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “There are definitely better hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Remember2
Reviews.Content: This was our least favorite hotel from my 2 week trip in Italy. It has 2 things going for it. 1) the location was pretty great; 2) they offered free wifi (most hotels should though so this isn't that big of plus). Right from the start the staff was not very friendly. I asked for restaurant recommendations and they couldn't have been less helpful. As a result, I ended up calling to make my own reservations and then they charged me at the end of the stay for the local phone calls. The room was old and somewhat dirty. The shower was the definition of grimy and the toilet ran the entire time. The breakfast was terrible. You need to get there early because they do not refill the food. Not once out of the 3 days I was there did I ever see them refill the food once they ran out of something. Basically its first come first serve. They charge you extra for coffee and for orange juice. The bottom line is that you are better off looking elsewhere for a hotel. You can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: Digitalogic8
Reviews.Content: They have alot of trouble suppling hot water to the rooms and they wasH the towels in vinegar. Don't stay here if showering is important to you. On our last morning at 9am we had no hot water, I called the front desk and the said they'd look into it, called again at 11 and they got mad because we weren't out of the room and said the have no hot water after 11. The hot water was spotty at best all other times.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: csinclaire
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times and have stayed along the Via Veneto, but next time we will once again stay at the Relais Fontana Di Trevi The staff could not have been nicer. We stayed in room 304 at the back of the hotel which was very quiet and quite large, our friends stayed across the hall in 303 on the street. They said at night they could hear some street noise, but that is why we travel with earplugs. The breakfast and the location, overlooking the Trevi, were so enjoyable, you want to linger.The selection at breakfast was quite extensive and frequently refreshed..Our wi-fi didn't work in our room so they gave us a cable so we could connect. Like I said the staff was very friendly and accommodating. This is a very clean hotel and so convenient to everything in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Casaserenafl6
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for its location, and their advertisement of free wi-fi. The locations is good, but there are many hotels in the area, so this is not unique to them. My room didn't have wi-fi, something I counted on in terms of keeping up with my business, and kids at home. When I asked to be moved to a different room, they were not nice about it, and told me they didn't have a room. People are not treated there like in the USA, when you expect the owner to go out of his way to make a patron happy. I would have looked for another hotel with wi-fi, but since I was there just for a short time, we decided to stay, and used internet connection in restaurants that offered it, and sometimes in the lobby of the hotel. The lobby had also a picture of the 'Che Guevara', that was offending to me, being of a latin background, and knowing the history of Cuba. In the States, private business owners don't make political statements, because they might offend some of their patrons. Not in the Relais Fontana di Trevi. I asked about the picture, and they told me that the picture is there because they like 'the Che', that murdered in their view the murderous allies of Batista. The room was small, but adequate. Good AC. Since there are SO many hotels in the area, and all include breakfast, I would never choose to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting Rome !”
Reviews.Author: Paintman13
Reviews.Content: This hotel (suites) Though not lavish was an excellent choice if you are visiting Rome for a short time. It was close to the Trevi Fountain ,so close in fact we could hear the water from our window. The room we had was comfortable and large by Rome standards. The staff was helpful and the location was perfect. Walking distance to most attractions and plenty of restaurants ,bakeries,and gelato shops nearby. No security issues as their was always a police presence and it felt safe to walk at night. Ate at a small outside cafe called the Golden Bar. The manager, Maximillian was friendly and the food was great.To save a few dollars you could get take -out from one of the bakeries and bring pizza, sandwiches, etc. back to your room.All in all we had a great time in Rome and would go back again and stay at the Relais Di Fontana Trevi luxury suites!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: LYNNDNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist, who gave us lots of maps and information about Rome.He also suggested places and areas to eat. We were placed in the hotels annex which is down the street about 20 metres and round the corner.We had 40 some steps to climb, which was OK. The rooms all seemed newly furnished and were very clean.For breakfast we had to walk back to the main hotel, again OK in good weather.The breakfast had plenty of choice and again the staff were friendly and attentive.The breakfast room had a patio with great views of the fountain. We found the annex very quiet.W e had read that the hotel had tea and coffee facilities in the rooms, but our rooms did not. Because we were leaving before breakfast on the last day we asked if we could have tea or coffee in the room, but we were told we could not, bit of a let down. Other than that the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: collecting-info
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, When we arrived we upgraded to the Junior Suite and had a window which overlooked the Trevi Fountain. The location was great and had lots of Restaurants nearby and plenty of shopping. While the hotel was expensive but worth the extra expense just for the view of the fountain. The Manager was obliging and friendly. We had breakfast on the terrace overlooking the fountain - a great way to start your day of sightseeing. The Airport Shuttle has trouble finding the hotel, however and we were dropped a street away from the hotel and struggled along the cobblestone roads with our luggage. Even the shop owners could not help us with finding our hotel - the hotel front is just a doorway with a staircase leading up to reception. Our Suite was massive and the hotel was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: PdubC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel at the end of Dec 2009 during our first trip to Europe. The location was truly unbeatable! It is literally a 3 second walk from the hotel door to the trevi fountain. The staff was very friendly and helpful also - our plane arrived 3 hours late and I sent an email to the staff asking them if it would be alright that we check in past midnight. I got an instant email reply saying that they would be waiting till we arrive no matter what time it will be! So, we arrived late at night (be warned of pre-arranging tranfers at the Rome airport!! The transfer company we booked through decided to 'close' so we had to arrange a new transfer to our hotel!) and the trevi fountain nearby was lit up - the scene was beautiful! The only comment we would like to make is the smell of the toilet - though seemingly clean - it did have an unpleasant smell about it... As for the trevi fountain - Be warned of the photographers around the trevi fountain - they like to take your pictures and then ask you for money! Also becareful of the rose sellers - they try to force-sell roses by placing roses in girls' hands and demanding money!

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to the review...”
Reviews.Author: Heiners
Reviews.Content: Well after all the hype this place was a giant let down. The location is good but we found the staff unhelpful and generally uninteresed. As first time visitors to Rome they definitely left a terrible impression!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Romance!”
Reviews.Author: greattravelfriend
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this wonderful small hotel in the very centre of Rome on several occasions and every time has been a delight. Although the rooms are small (tell me where they aren't in a hotel with an ounce of atmosphere in Italy), they are beautifully decorated and meticulously maintained....and very clean. Breakfast here is the highlight. The breakfast room sits on the top level high above the Trevi Fountain, which we sat and admired over strong Italian coffee, pastries, cheeses and so on. I will return to this hotel and I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the WORST hotels we stayed in Europe. No Sleep!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clea700
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge a bit on this hotel due to the location as it was our last stop of a 5 week holiday around Europe. This was by far the WORST hotel we stayed in. The air conditioner broke or probably didn't work to begin with so it was stuck on heat instead of cool meaning we woke up drenched in sweat. The first night we slept through it but woke up hot (and with a cold/flu), the second night we tried turning off the air con as in other hotels this kicks in the air con - it didn't work but we slept through it, by the third night we were over it, I was really sick and we rang reception at 2am and the man who came up couldn't get it to work so our only alternative was to sleep with the windows open - with a nearby church bell ringing literally every 15 minutes! Obviously we didn't get any sleep. When we complained the following morning upon checking out the reception girl said that the manager wasn't in, couldn't be contacted but to email him and he will refund our money for the final night and assured us she would tell him what happened. We emailed the manager to ask for a reimbursement of our final night stay when we received no sleep which I feel was reasonable as we complained in the night and the night reception guy agreed that the room was very hot. After many emails back and fourth with someone who would probably win the rudest hotel manager of Italy award - he has refused to refund us for our final night stay even though one of his staff members said he would. All he cared about in his email exchange was to mention repeatedly that he will refer us to his lawyers if we wrote about our experience at his hotel. Other reviews on this site have repeatedly made mention of how rude he is also. Other negative points about this hotel - we asked on the first day if the receptionist could ring and book a restaurant for us (no other hotel has had issue with doing this) and she said "Perhaps you could just ring and do this yourself" - at ridiculous call rates from the room and from our mobile phones? I think not. I'm sure the hotel had some positive points aside from the location near the Trevi but after dealing with such a rude manager who has refused to apologise or reimburse us, I can't seem to recall any. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and those that have given a favourable review have probably been lucky enough not to have to complain about anything to the management of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge!”
Reviews.Author: Accorsi2x2
Reviews.Content: Yes, Rome is expensive but if you're going and can afford to do so, I recommend you splurge on the Fontana di Trevi. We were completely satisfied in all aspect of our stay. The location couldn't be better and as I have traveled to Rome before and stayed out of the center, I can say with certainty that staying somewhere close to so many attractions really enhances the trip overall. However, as it is in the center, it is advisable to bring only the hand luggage that you will need during those days (we stored the rest of our stuff @ the train station) and to take the subway to the nearest stop and walk over to the hotel. Super easy and cost efficient. The room itself was HUGE, especially by Rome standards. But really, it was a large room by any standard. The bathroom was also huge and well appointed with nice amenities (slippers were a lovely touch) and never lacked for hot water. We had a small window/balcony that overlooked a side street (no view of the fountain but no matter) and when you walked out the Trevi Fountain was just a few steps to the left. All around us were restaurants, smaller squares, monuments and sights that were easily walked to. Just in the first two days we saw most of the major sights on foot. All in all, this was a perfect hotel experience for us and when we return to Rome we will definitely stay at the Fontana di Trevi. Suz & Dave New Orleans, USA

Reviews.Title: “All the positive reviews are TRUE!”
Reviews.Author: martingiles
Reviews.Content: My wife have just stayed (5) nights at this wonderful hotel and the positive reviews couldn't be more true. We were met early on our day of arrival as if were old friends who had come to visit. We arrived well before check-in, yet they upgraded us to a room that was ready............and it was just grand. I have read remarks about how small European rooms are, but this room was just right for the two of us and we did not feel crowded in any way(if you want to see small, try a NYC hotel room sometime). The breakfast was more than adequate with pastries, eggs ,bacon, yogurt, meats,cheeses, fruit,cereal,coffee,etc. The service was both friendly and efficient..............so all that being said, I don't know what more anyone would want in a hotel that is centrally located to nearly everything a tourist might want. Were my wife and I to return anytime soon to this beautiful city we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else! ---------------------

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DawniePerth
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic. Able to walk to all the main attractions. Rooms clean and free wireless internet. Lovely view of the Trevi Fountain from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location - Fantastic Breakfast - Super Service”
Reviews.Author: SewHappy58
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Rome. The location was perfect for us. It was within easy walking distance to major attractions and bus routes. The tourist office was only a few blocks away. The rooms were fantastic. The manager upgraded us to a spacious premium room. Bathrooms fantastic. The only complaint I might have made was that the pillows were a bit hard and it might have been nice to have a bit softer pillow. But I guess that depends on your preference. Breakfast was fantastic. Not only did they have the typical Roman fare of cold cuts, cheese and breads, but they also provided several types of eggs, including omlette and crepes. Staff was wonderful and eager to please. Free internet was great since we didn't book any tours and wanted up to date information. Make sure you mention this to the reception when checking in. You will need a password/login information. I love the setting of this hotel. No road traffic but lots of people. It might have been noisy at night but since the windows were excellent double pane, they blocked out all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNell
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Yes it was pricey, but it was worth it for us as we got to sit on the breakfast terrace each morning and look at the trevi fountain. What a view. The room was big, but shower small. There was no view of the trevi fountain from the room, but you could see the crowd around it. It was close to a tourist bus stop and near all shops and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helped us with our questions, even recommended the jewish region which we would never have found on our own. The little white dog in the lobby was a treat. The upstairs terrace serve a reasonably priced dinner and is a great place to have a few drinks at night. Even though the room was pricey, we enjoyed it for it's location. It was always clean and nice to come back to each evening after a long day - and even nicer to find the chocolates on our pillow. The free internet access was very handy too. I would recommend this hotel, but be prepared to pay for it due to it's location and view.

Reviews.Title: “A Super Hotel.... But A Manager With An Attitude !!!”
Reviews.Author: boyinjun
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Relais Fontana Di Trevi ... what a super location... for which you pay top prices too !!! We had a room on the road on the edge of the fountain, making it it a bit noisy thanks to humans visiting !! But that is the charm !! For the prices that you pay, one would expect a lot more in terms of Services... but, was surprised to find that the Bed Linen was not changed during our stay... in addition, one night we had a problem with the air conditioning & no hot water, which was subsequently fixed.. but the General Manager, who was aware of the problem, as we were vociferous with the Front Desk, made no approach to pacify us nor apologise for the inconvenience !!! The staff working at the Hotel are super.. all speaking good English... the staff come from from Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Argentina, Philippines & Italy... they would bend over backwards to assist us & other guests. One aspect that was most refreshing was the Breakfast... the only Hotel that we have come across in Italy, who serve a Hot Breakfast Buffet... SCRAMBLED EGGS !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel – Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: haplo888
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of a tourist area we had some reservations, but the Relais Fontana di Trevi did not disappoint. The staff was extremely eager to help and spoke good English. Any time that we had an issue or question a staff member was at our door within a minute to find a solution. The location cannot be beat and the restaurant is very nice. (save your fountain visit for late at night.) Our room was on the rear of the hotel and was quiet. We will stay here again. Our room was plush and comfortable, typical Italian shower, and there was an HD TV with satellite that even had American stations like the History Channel and Fox News. Some station's audio could be changed into English or German. The rooms had both Ethernet and Wi-FI and you can rent a laptop for 20Euros per 24 hours. Far better rates and speed than we’ve found elsewhere. Front desk information about the surroundings’ opening times and transportation could be better, but I hesitate to even mention it as this is true in all the hotels we’ve stayed in Italy/Rome and the Relais was better than most. As mentioned in another review we also witnessed the Manager John be harsh with an employee, which should be handled in private. The restaurant also surpassed our expectations with good service that is rare to find in Italy, even in Rome. Some food was excellent, some was good, but all of it was better than you will find in the tourist trap restaurants on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pleasant decor, helpful staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: RTullis
Reviews.Content: We paid a bit more for this hotel than for those that seemed similar in order to get the great location. It was worth it, as it was still less than other hotels with comparable locations. Very convenient, and great fun to be near the Fountain. Upon arriving for a 7 night stay, we found we had been upgraded to a large room (106) with a street view (the Fountain itself was just out of view but we could watch the crowds at it). The rooms are beautifully decorated with fabric upholstered walls and white-painted beamed ceilings. I thought the art choices were unfortunate, they clashed unsympathetically with the otherwise classy decor; black and white photos of the fountain and neighborhood would have been a simpler and better choice. Bathrooms are clean, 4 fixture rooms, if a bit tight in the narrow dimension. Rooms feature a built-in desk with refrigerator and four foot closet with a safe. The small but sufficient lobby is on the first floor (what Americans call the second) up a narrow stairway, but the staff rushes to carry all luggage, so no problem. A free computer with internet access in the corner of the lobby is quite convenient. Sliding glass doors isolate each corridor from the stair and associated noise. Cabs called by the front desk respond very quickly, arriving through the pedestrian congestion within 5 minutes. The staff is good. The manager John is competent and runs a tight ship, although you get the impression he is a bit stiff. Alejandro at the front desk and Red on the roof deck were delights. I regretted that my last apertivo meant no more nightly joking with Red. They have a small white "lobby dog" named Willy, who is very friendly. Breakfast is varied, plentiful, and good. The roof deck, as many have mentioned as a great corner view of the Fountain, and makes breakfast fun. They have a nice indoor room too, if the weather is cold. The hotel is trying to get a bar/restaurant business going at night on the roof deck. I had before-dinner drinks (an Aperol spritz initially suggested by Red) every night, but never ate dinner there. Very pleasant way to begin the evening. The staff seems to have a good sense of the guest's coming and goings (probably tracked via the electronic key cards in the light slots), as the room always seemed to be cleaned and made up at the right time, and chocolates always appeared on our pillows before we returned at night no matter what our schedule. All wake-up calls requested were on time. Street noise is present, but the double-glazed and weatherstripped windows block most of it out when you don't want it. Only on our first night (a Friday) did it interfere with sleeping when some college students decided to go swimming in the fountain at 2:00 AM, complete with war whoops and cheering. The street itself is full of activity, fun if you like it (and we did), but it is not a secluded hotel. I would recommend the Relais Fontana di Trevi without hesitation, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Roma”
Reviews.Author: Vliu
Reviews.Content: Rome is an absolutely lovely city. Everything you've heard is true, it is indeed the heart of Europe. I live in Fort Lauderdale Florida US and i traveled to Italy by myself. The way from the airport to my hotel was amazing! It was dark but i could see thru my taxi cab windows many beautiful monuments throwout the city; i was literately blown away. I had never in my life seen a monument of the size of the Victor Emmanuel II in piazza Venezia. My hotel was right across from la Fontana di Trevi, the sole purpose of my trip. I stayed at the Relais Fontana di Trevi Hotel. I believe this was a 3 star hotel and it was perfect! Not too expensive, room service was great, breakfast up in the terrace was just what i had hoped for. From the Fontana di Trevi to Vatican city is probably about an hour walk. I'm personally not a fan of walking but there is so much to see that it makes it all worth it. Besides if you like sweets and you are in Rome, make sure to get a cannoli, this Palermo originated pastry is the best walking partner :) The Roman Colosseum, is not as big as i expected to be, yet it is a huge part of Roman history. I wouldn't recommend paying the extra 6 euros to get the audio tour, it was just confusing. On the other hand, It is a good idea to get with a tour group, sometimes they are a bit more expensive but it eliminates the waiting time in line to get in. Another thing to have in consideration is "L'uomo italiano" (the italian man). They are handsome, charming and speak one of the sexiest languages in the world. You would think this is enough to go crazy for them.....wrong!!! I found them to be a bit too aggressive when it comes about flirting. For me this spoiled the idea to get away for a few days alone. They like to get wayyyy too close. So this is my advice for all woman, Do not go alone. it is better if you go with a friend or anyone you know. It can be scary at times. Vatican City, this place is a must. I ended up going there twice just to see La Basilica di San Pietro. A few blocks away is the Vatican museum, in there is the Sixteen Chapel with Miguel Angelo master piece. Rome is by far the most beautiful city i have ever been to, i would love to go back as soon as i get a chance. Next time during summer time, Christmas in Italy was beautiful, just a bit too cold for a Florida girl. Buon Viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: ADBTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little more expensive than others we stayed at during our trip, but having the great location was certainly worth it! Upon arrival we were immediately upgraded to a room with a partial view of the Trevi Fountain. You could shut the window, but I enjoyed keeping it open to hear the sounds of the water rushing down the fountain and tourists below. I was so worn out by the end of each day, that the noise didn't bother me a bit. The room was large, as was the bathroom. Rooms in Europe are typically very small, but this one was spacious. Everything was very clean as well, both in the room and in the common areas. We even saw one of the employees hand-cleaning the stairs one of the mornings we were there. All of the employees were very nice and pleasant to us--no complaints there. There was a great selection for breakfast, with a nice partial view of the fountain. Keep in mind that they do tend to shut off the fountain each morning and clean it at about the same time each day (at least while we were there), so you may want to plan around that if you would prefer to eat while it is actually running. (I believe it was closed roughly around 8 to 9am, if I remember correctly.) There is free access to the computer in the lobby, which was nice too. Overall, I think it's a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pleasedtraveler081
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Sept 4-6, 2009 prior to a cruise. The shuttle dropped us off 1 1/2 blocks away stating they could not get through the street. Needless to say when we got to the hotel they held our bags until the room was ready at noon. The porter brought our bags to the room (#105), which was a nice king bedded room. Our pillows were hard but the bed was fine. We did not hear noise over the street, and had a view of the fountains from our room. everything worked fine for us and the staff were very helpful. You are paying for the location here but it is central to rome and the view for breakfast of the fountains is very good. They ran a clean hotel, provided map of the area and sights marked without asking, as well as recommendations. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I got the short end of the stick”
Reviews.Author: BrisCaz
Reviews.Content: I am ambivalent about this hotel. Part of me wants to slam it because I had such an awful room and part of me wants to praise it because there were some good things about it. My main grumble with this hotel was that I "got the short end of the stick" and I was bitterly disappointed with my room - it was nothing like what had been portrayed on their website. Everyone else reviewing this hotel has praised the "spacious" rooms and the views. Well, I was in a cramped [supposedly] double room at the back with no view at all. It was quite awful and not worth the money. It also seems like all other reviewers suffered from noise - well I definitely did not suffer any noise stuffed at the back of the hotel as I was. To top it all off, the room was pretty claustrophobic. I cant imagine how two people would go staying in there. The bathroom was pretty basic and the shower rose was broken - which I complained about the first morning but it didnt really get fixed. When I went down to reception to remind them that it needing fixing, the Manager was at reception at the time and he grumbled at me for "only just reporting this at 6pm" ......he would not listen to my explanation that I already had reported it. The bed was okay - not particularly soft but bearable enough. The pillows were good which helped make up for the bed. The air conditioning struggled in the heat wave. Breakfast was ok and it was on the roof top terrace overlooking the fountain, which was nice particularly for me coming from my room with n view. The eggs were cold, but there was a reasonable selection of stuff and I cant really compain about the breakfast. On the plus side, I thought that the staff in reception were fantastic and really helpful. Though I do have to agree with one reviewer who commented that for a 4 star hotel it was lacking in a lot of things. I would stay here again but I would make darn sure I had a decent room with a view. However, if you want to stay here and not have noise I would recommend that you ask for the cramped horrible back room.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hotel in the heart of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: sooz_h
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in March 2009 for 3 nights. We had planned to stay in their studio apartment, but we were upgraded to one of the suites on arrival which was brilliant. The hotel is located up a narrow street opposite the Trevi fountain, which is fantastic, but taxis can't reach the door so be prepared to lug your cases down a short distance down a cobbled street past a LOAD of tourist at the fountain. The reception is also up a narrow stairs, as are all the rooms, so it would deffo not be suitable for people with disabilities or in wheelchairs. That said, its a lovely hotel. The manager recommended a lovely restaurant - Chianti - accross the road on our first night and it was the nicest meal i've had out for the money. The metro is a short walk away and all the sights are nearby. The breakfast is nice, there is plenty there and its the usual fare. The suite we stayed in was HUGE and looked over the fountain - which to be fair is noisy during the day right up to midnight and after, but there is double glazing windows which does clock the sound out. Its a lovely spot, a bit on the expensive side, but if you like a bit of luxury, its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel manager”
Reviews.Author: mspath
Reviews.Content: Beware of the hotel manager, John! He has a temper. We witnessed him firing an employee on the spot! Whatever the issue this is a private matter that should have been done in his office not in the lobby! As for the hotel, it has a decent view of the trevi fountain but sort of slanted not direct. The rooms are spacious but lack the amenities you would expect for "luxury suites" as advertised. For instance, the towels were rather thin and worn down, no lotion, plastic cups. Now this would be fine for a 2 star hotel but we did not expect this for the fountain view suite. In fact the shower had mildew on its tiles that hadnt been cleaned for ages. These suites are directly abvove the dining hall so watch out to be woken up early when people who have early breakfasts drag their chairs. TV channels are basic. Breakfast was also basic with cold omelets and packaged rather than fresh items. The staff isnot very helpful. We asked for help with lost luggage but they refused to help unlike other hotels in Italy that went out of their way to make complimentary long distance calls and or use the internet. In closing, we were extremely disappointed with the hotel particularly because we had high expectations of the fountain facing "luxury site" but got basic stuff unlike other 4 star hotels in Italy where we received fantastatic service and amenities. Would never go back or recommend anybody to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views from your hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Harlaxton0530
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Relais Fontana Di Trevi for 4 night in early July for our Honeymoon. We stayed in the Apartment Loft which is about 20 yards away from the main building. However, from our kitchenette we could look out the window and see the Trevi Fountain whenever we wanted! The loft was great for the two of us as it was very spacious when considering European standards, and would be great for families. Another great thing about the Trevi fountain is that is very centrally located in Rome. In the summer, the roads are so crowded that Taxi rides become way too expensive since it takes them forever to navigate...soooo, you'll be walking, ALOT. The Trevi Fountain is about a 5 minute walk to the Pantheon, a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, 20 minute walk to the Coliseum and Roman Forum, and about a 25-30 minute walk to the Vatican City. Breakfast was fantastic at the hotel as well, even if you have to walk to the main building to get it. The hotel staff was very friendly, courteous, helpful, and spoke English very well. The first thing they did upon our arrival is give us a map of rome and highlight the fastest routes to all of Rome's most famous attractions. The Trevi Fountain is a great landmark of Rome and there's no better picture than in front of it when nobody else is around (which is only from 2-7am) - which can be taken easily when you're practically living in it! However, if you're looking for a place that's peaceful and quiet away from all the hustle and bustle of Rome, this is not the place for you, since you'll definitely hear the crowd noise from 9am to around midnight every night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: timasich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in late June and found it to be spectacular! Our main desire was to be in the centre of Rome so that we could easily walk around the city and not have to worry about public transport... It was so amazing to be right on the doorstep of the Trevi Fountain and to be able to see it from the breakfast terrace! No matter how many times we walked past or looked at the fountain I was still blown away by its grandeur... The service was exceptional and our room was beautiful (we were in the annex). Even though were were in such a busy area we could not hear a sound from our room. The only slight issue was the very low water pressure in the shower, but apart from that everything was amazing. The breakfast selection was great too- nice pastries, meats, cheeses and bacon/eggs. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Top service - top location - beatiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: ENEOslo
Reviews.Content: The Relais Fontana di Trevi was better than expected. We had booked a room at the annex to a very good price. When we arrived, we were told that we were upgraded to a room at the main building. I travelled with my mother (66) and she really appriciated that. Easier to go to the breakfast room in the morning - it was in the same floor. We also went to the terrace in the evening. Nice staff there - always smiling and so welcoming. Wonderful view to the Trevi fountain. The management and all the staff were so helpful and nice - this must be the best hotel in Rome - with "service from the heart"!! The room was so quiet - we didn't here any noise from outside - not even from the corridor. If you are looking for a relaxing plays to stay in the historical center of Rome - stay at Relais Fontana di Trevi!

Reviews.Title: “The Trevi Fountain is right out the door!”
Reviews.Author: MiriamLisa
Reviews.Content: I took my 65 yr old mom on a 2 week trip to Italy for a special birthday gift. When I was planning the itinerary I asked her what is it she most wanted to see or do while in Italy. Her first response was to make sure she would get to see the Trevi fountain. When I came across this hotel I knew it was the one. Everything was great and they really do leave you a chocalete on your pillow! Although you are in the heart of "tourist central" the hotel itself is extremly peaceful and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -unbelivable location”
Reviews.Author: CurlySis
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel! Nice rooms cleaned twice-a-day (with a little chocolate and a "good-night" on the pillow every night we came in). Good breakfast, especially if you get a table on the roof-top overlooking the Trevi fountain!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel w/ fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Autumn23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during a 2 week trip to Italy. This hotel was our favorite of all our hotels in Italy. The location is the best part of this hotel. The entrance is only steps away from the Trevi Fountain. Every morning we ate breakfast out on the hotel's terrace and enjoyed views of the fountain. What a wonderful way to start every day. Morning is the best time to see the fountain because there is no one around the fountain. As the day progresses, the area around the fountain becomes packed with tourists. The hotel's central location allowed us to everywhere. It was about a 30 minute walk to the Vatican and a 15-20 minute walk to the train station and colosseum area. The location allowed us to spend the day out exploring the city and easily return to our room for some re-energizing before heading out to enjoy the city at night. Our room was satisfactory. It was always clean and comfortable. We did not have a room with a view, but this was not important to us. We just wanted a convenient place to rest. The bathroom was large for Italy and well laid out. The hotel's staff was extremely helpful. Apon arrival the provided us with a map of the city and showed us the best routes to get to each site. They also did a good job of recommending places to eat. The breakfast was nice. There was breads and jam, lunch meats and cheese, eggs, bacon, yogurt, fruit, and juices. A very nice variety. We loved this hotel and would definitely recommend the hotel. My parents are visiting Rome in October and they will be staying here based on our recommendation. If we are lucky enough to return to Rome ourselves we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimmyfloyd01
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of tripadvisor research prior to booking rome as previous place i had stayed was very ordinary. i found this one which had good reviews and location was so good. price was quite reasonable to. we arrived at train station at 7am after 24 hour journey from melbourne. got a taxi and got ripped off badly, he charged 20 euros, it should have been 7-8euro the reception staff told me! anyway it made me more aware for rest of trip. our room was ready which was such a relief as we needed the shower after the long trip. room was nice, good 4 star. bathroom was also good. it was winter so bar/terrace wasnt open at night, but breakfast is served on top floor with terrace open then so could take advantage of great view overlooking trevi fountain. we walked everywhere in rome as nothing is really to far away. vatican is maybe longest and thats only 30min walk. trevi fountain is so nice and was good to grab a beer and sit there enjoying the views. rome is beautiful and has so many sites to see. the most annoying part of the city though is the constant pestering of people trying to sell u things such as umbrellas, toys, keyrings etc. and they keep coming back if u are sitting there. i had to tell a few where to go, which they didnt take to well! i was a bit disappointed with the food, probably because we were in the tourist areas so they dont really care about there food as people come in regardless. i thought this place was very good value and u wont be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: melay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais Fontana Di Trevi in December 2008 for 2 nights. The hotel is way too good than I expected, we stayed in a regular room which is large and clean. The location is just perfect, we walked everywhere, even to the Vatican. The atmosphere of the street is amazing, just in front of the Fontana di Trevi and the sound of the water can be heard when you open the windows. The breakfast is very delicious in a very lovely decorated dining room. In the summer breakfast is served in a terrace which has Fontana di Trevi view. The hotel has an elevator; you just have to use the stairs to the reception on the first floor. Our flight was very early in the morning so we did not pay for the room at the last night and spent the whole day walking and shopping around. After midnight we still had a couple of hours to be spent and we sit and relaxed in the leather coaches in front of TV at the reception till our shuttle arrived. I would definitely stay at Relais Fontana Di Trevi when I go to Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NedaAthens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful small hotel,it is romantic with big rooms. You can enjoy your breakfast or your drink in the night in the terrace from where you can see the Fontana di trevi. The stuff is very kind and friendly . You will have to overcome a few steps in the entrance :) The only bad thing is that the area is always so crowded and when you will leave or get back in the hotel you will have to face all this people. Dont worry inside the room is quite .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lavendergirl08
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, large rooms, beautifully decorated and the best location possible, right near the Trevi Fountain. At night we could hear the music from accordian players and the sound of the water from the Trevi in our room if we left the windows and shutters open. The terrace was a wonderful place for meals and drinks thanks to the great service provided by Justin and Red. There is a magical view of the Trevi from the terrace at night. We would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Relais Fontana Di Trevi is a Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelAround
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location. You can walk to so many of the main sites from here. The rooms are wonderful (I had a room with a street view) and the service is very good. The people who work here are very pleasant and helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc.. The breakfast is good with enough choices to start your day. When I return I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: CarolynOntario
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop in our tour of Italy. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Internet use is free for hotel guests. The location is wonderful. We were able to walk to every major attraction. Excellent restaurants are within a 1-5 minute walk from the front door of the hotel. We were able to sit on the rooftop terrace for breakfast each morning. This is overlooking the Trevi Fountain. Given the location, we were shocked at how quiet our room was. Perhaps because we were on the back side of the hotel. Breakfast was included and it had the best selection of all the hotels that we stayed in during our 2 week tour!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimrusssauer
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel with a great location. We booked 3 rooms for 6 people in our family, they gave us all on the same floor next to each other. staff was wonderful and very helpful. Rooms were quite large for Europe and a very good / large bath. free internet as well. located by almost all the sites in rome, as we walked to everything but the Vatican, almost everything else can be seen by foot. The fountain is crowded but in the early morning when no one was around, it was an incredible site to behold. breakfast is very complete with eggs, juice, coffee and rolls. the rooftop bar is very nice for breakfast and drinks at night. highly reccomend this hotel for great large rooms, friendly staff, and close to all the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted!”
Reviews.Author: SuViseu
Reviews.Content: I loved my short stay at this hotel. I arrived early and left my luggage there, they gave me a map so I could start exploring Rome. When I returned to the hotel, my luggage was already in my room! The room was spacious and so was the bathroom. Someone accompanied me to my room and showed me the refrigerator that had 2 bottles of water that were for free (very useful when a bottle of water costs 2 euros in the center of Rome!) You can find small supermarkets nearby if you want to stock the fridge with some drinks. What I loved about this hotel were so many things: First of all, it is right in front of the magnificent Trevi Fountain. My room didn’t have a view to the fountain, but I was glad because I didn’t hear any noise. You can walk to almost all major sights and stop at the hotel to freshen up. Around the Trevi Fountain you will find everything: restaurants, gelatos (the ice-cream is delicious), shops, McDonalds, automatic cash machines, it was just perfect! You also have free access to internet ay the hotel. And the metro station is a 5 minute walk away! On the 3rd floor there is a terrace with a view to the fountain. You can have breakfast on the terrace and at night you can just enjoy a drink or pizza and pasta if you want to eat dinner. The staff was always pleasant and nice. In the room, almost all the channels were in Italian, but they had pay per view with recent movies in English. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Muratte Loft (Relais Trevi's Self Catering Apartment) An Incredible Opportunity”
Reviews.Author: scarpenter4
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the "Muratte Loft" which is just a few steps away on the other side of the fountain. YES it does a great view of the Trevi Fountain... and when Rome is hot enough to fry an egg on the pavement...it's a wonderful place to sit and enjoy both the a/c and the view ! For those who want to try an apartment... wow what a deal ! you don't have to pay a cleaning charge and breakfast for 2 is included at Relais Trevi's beautiful roof top Terrace, complete with Trevi Fountain view. If you search "Muratte Loft" or look at the Relais Trevi's home page...the pictures are very accurate.
