You can also find a video tour on Utube (also on RT's website) I don't always give high scores...but I did lots of Trip Advisor research and can say that all 4 hotels chosen with TA's help were solid 5 Star finds... including Relais Trevi. I would say that I'd never opt for the Trevi neighborhood again, and would have been quite happy to have stayed my entire stay in the Piazza Navona area (which I think has many more advantages for "the average tourist" But if you want Trevi... Relais Trevi is a GREAT FIND, and the Muratte Loft is a GREAT DEAL. !! All contact with the hotel staff was excellent, the breakfast is a bit more (eggs & sausage) than a typical Italian buffet.. and I could not think of a more beautiful place to enjoy your morning coffee. Both the Muratte Loft and the hotel's roof terrace have some of the best views available (and these fountain views are very limited with 99.99999999% of Trevi Fountain tourists never haveing the opportunity to experience the view in this way. YES its a unique experience and I'm glad we did it once. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vonsie
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay here while on a recent busines trip to Rome. The room I had was huge and the bathroom had been recently renovated. The hotel was a bit of a challenge to find as it is just a doorway on a side street from the fountain, as the reception etc is on the first floor. The staff were extremely helpful in organising transportation for us to a location a long way outside Rome. My room was €250 for a single stay but it was a double room including breakfast. The breakfast was fine without being wonderful, but you can sit outside on the rooftop terrace looking at the fountain which more than compensates for it. The room I had was on the 1st floor right on the main street, and yes it was noisy when the windows & shutters were open but the windows must be soundproofed as when I closed them the sound was totally blocked out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: mau18
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at Fontana di Trevi for three days in May. We were sharing one room so were very pleased at the size and quality of the room we were given. Check the website. The pictures are exactly as the room appeared. It was in imaculate condition as was the breakfast area and the reception area. There is a small, but adequate outdoor terrace where you can have a very nice breakfast buffet with a most accomodating staff to take care of your every need. There is of course a nice indoor breakfast room as well. The view from the terrace balcony is of the Trevi Fountain where you can enjoy the wonderful sight of those magnificent statues and waterfalls in peace and quiet. Our room was on the side street which was closed as repairs were being made to the pavement so the hotel had the valet meet our limo from the airport at the next corner so we never had to carry a bag. As for noise, of course in the day time with the workers below, it was a bit noisy, but as soon as the windows were closed it was quiet. At night, with the heavy windows and the outside shutters, we could hear nothing. We really liked the location and especially the hotel staff and our accomodations. I hope you enjoy it there as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: tolch21
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 days in this hotel, and that was very very nice. Very friendly staff, good service, very clean and about location!!! I needn't toexplain anything. And what more we need for the grate vacation?!!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DELIGHTFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: skiathostown
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a Friday to Monday break at this hotel. We had a lovely time. This was our 2nd trip to Rome but our first time at this hotel. We would not hesitate in going back and staying here. The rooms are very clean and more than adequate. The hotel staff are so friendly and cheerful. Yes the area outside the hotel is busy but what else do you expect being so close to the Fountain. We didnt find this a problem, the hotel is in a fantastic location. Go there you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY DISAPPOINTED: If you want to sleep, go elsewhere & watch the manager”
Reviews.Author: CCBMT
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here for his birthday at the beginning of March 2008. After carrying out extensive hotel research I selected this hotel due to its location but having noted there was sometimes a problem with noise, I phoned the hotel and specifically asked for a quiet room. It was a nightmare - we had no sleep at all the first night and complained. We were moved to an 'attic room' (which would be unbearable in the summer due to the heat), and yes, it was quieter, but what really makes matters worse is that the manager verbally agreed to a €50 refund on the room rate for the first night, which, after we had checked out, he reneged on. So watch out. I definitely would not stay here again. I was REALLY DISAPPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerri53
Reviews.Content: Would highly reccomend this hotel, very freindly staff who make you feel really welcome.Nice breakfast, lovely comtortable rooms.We were staying here for our silver wedding anniversary and we could not have wished for better with the hotel and location would definatley reccomend this hotel for someone who wants something a little special

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...ignore the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce-and-Carol
Reviews.Content: Believe the positives that you read here! We continue to be truly lucky with our hotel selections (tripadviser may just play a part?) and the Relais Fontana di Trevi continues our good experiences. We won't add anything to the good reviews, but our response to the very few negatiives is: (a) the terrace is lovely for a beer, but if it's not open for any reason, there are about a dozen bars within 50 yards (b) the hassle in the square is to be expected (if you are a tourist) and the hotel cannot do anything about that (c) the rooms are more than adequate for a competitively priced hotel right in the heart of the City, and (d) if the morning coffee is not to your liking the staff will gladly get you a fresh espresso from the kitchen with a smile. A little gem with fine staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Gillian41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right beside the Trevi Fountain. This, by implication would mean that the rooms are very noisy - there is a little noise but nothing to write a bad review about! The windows are triple glazed to keep out as much of the tourist banter as possible - it didn't cause a problem. However, what did cause issue with us was the building work that started on morning one of our holiday at 8.10am - the noise was deafening and after contacting reception, I felt sure that nothing was going to be done about it, as they said it was from an adjoining property. That being said, by the time we had finished breakfast, we were told we were moving to a higher room away from the noise and were given a massive apology for any inconvenience caused. Our new room was much nicer, not that our previous room was bad. The girl on reception was most helpful and really pulled out all the stops to sort our problem out extremely quickly and we were very relieved. The rooms in the hotel are a good size, if a bit warm. The stairs are very steep and the staff will insist on taking your bags from you - there is a lift, so don't be concerned! Breakfast is typical hotel fayre and nothing to write home about. The location of the hotel is excellent! Your are a stone's throw away from Via del Corso and the many bus routes that eminate from there and the shopping is heaven is you are a shoe junkie like me. We bought a Roma pass which was excellent - we got into two Museums for free and all public transport was free also. January is a good time to go to Rome. The sales are on and there is very little queueing for the top attractions. The weather is cold but bright. Restaurants - I would recommend two. Del Sostegno near the Pantheon - tiny trattoria with the most wonderful truffles (and dessert wine) we went there twice - great wine list and fresh typically italian food. Then there is San Marco, near the American Embassy - this is a modern restaurant, with limited atmosphere - but the food is top notch! Three things I would warn you about. We found the Archeobus tour a massive disappointment (open top bus tour around the catacombs etc) - really dull! Also the hawkers around the Trevi are such a pain! Especially the rose sellers - who are the lowest of the low. And finally, the museum of modern art - another disappointment, with completely disinterested staff. Luckily we caught the Pop Art exhibition which was fantastic. We hadn't been to Rome for twelve years and it didn't disappoint. I would recommend this hotel for location and comfort and I would definitely use it again. Gillian, Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonJimmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner only for one night, but for the time we spent in the hotel it was a very pleasurable experience. We got off to a good start when we arrived 3 hours before check in expecting to just drop our bags, but our room was ready and we were allowed to occupy. The room was nice and spacious, with flatscreen TV, nice equipped bathroom, wooden floor, sofa, fridge. The only minor gripes I had were a rather firm bed and what sounded like a water heater in the wall which turned on randomly with a bit of noise. Also, the shower water temperature was unpredictable (ie from hot to cold when someone flushes the toilet in another room or something...). The location is great as your are within walking distance to many attractions, although take care and watch out walking along the busy/narrow roads!! The Trevi fountain is nice although understandably busy, and you get a lot of street sellers trying to win your custom with tacky items which taints the beauty of the area somewhat. The only issue I had with the hotel was the breakfast, which was a big let down for me. Instant machine coffee and OJ were not what i was expecting, accompanied by a slim variety of pastries, toast and unattractive scrambled egg and frankfurters. I would certainly recommend this hotel to stay, although maybe give the breakfast a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, the location, the staff - Loved Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: PM_and_CM
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay at Relais Fontana di Trevi. We had the hotel arrange for a driver to pick us up at the airport (I think it cost 10 euro more than the normal taxi fare) and it was well worth it. The driver even managed to work his way down Via Del Lavatore and dropped us right at the door!! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was a problem, and they patiently answered all of our questions such as "how do we get to ..." or "where can we find ...". Agnes was particulary helpful, so too was Red, who served us drinks at the rooftop bar. This is a great spot on a nice evening: it has a good view of the fountain, and an intimate atmosphere - kind of feels like it is YOUR very OWN club. It's THE perfect place to soak up some local wine and the beauty of the Trevi Fountain. We stayed in one of the Junior Suites and the room was large and well appointed. Best of all our window looked out onto the street and gave us a great view of the fountain. We had a birds-eye view of all the hectic activity, yet the triple-glazed windows meant we could sleep at night when they were closed. For atmosphere though, leave the window open as long as you can!! The location is really central, with lots of eating places and shopping close by. Really, for so few days in Rome (we wished we'd stayed longer), we could not have picked a more perfect place. We would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FuninPhx71
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Relais Fontana di Trevi for 5 nights and it was terrific. Most cars don't go down the Via Del Lavatore, so we had to drag our suitcases through the cobblestone streets when we arrived, but it was no big deal. Check-in is at 2 pm. The rooms are spacious for Italy, especially in the downtown areas, the location is fantastic. You can't see the fountain from the rooms, but you can from the rooftop. The fountain is centrally located to most attractions, so we literally walked everywhere. There are dozens of restaurants near the hotel and we were a stone's throw from the Pantheon, and it was a scenic walk to get there. It is a bit noisy outside, but that's to be expected at a tourist stop that people around the world come to see. It didn't keep us up at night. Also, the hairdryer was a typical european hair dryer that is kind of like a vacuum cleaning attachment, so bring your own hairdryer if you rely on one at all. The breakfast was very good - eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals, etc. The rooftop terrace overlooking the Trevi was beautiful and the food is very good too (and I can speak comparatively being in Italy for two weeks). An additional note - the hotel staff was very helpful to us and provided assistance to us - even calling the tour company to have them pick us up! I would definitely recommend the Relais Fontana di Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: telarika
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. We were skeptical because of the limited number of Tripadviser reviews but we took a chance and are so happy that we did. This was one of our favorite hotels in Italy. The location is great; you can walk to just about every sight in the city and there are tons of good restaurants and gelaterias right outside of the hotel. The rooms are large and very clean. The hotel appeared to be quite new or recently remodeled as everything was nicely updated, including the rooftop cafe. The staff, especially the owner/manager, was extremely helpful with giving directions and answering questions. In fact, they gave us wireless internet for free! And all the rooms have satellite TV, which is refreshing after typcially having only one english speaking channel throughout Europe. The hotel and especially the rooftop restaurant overlook the Trevi fountain, which is most popular at night, so the street can be a bit noisy if you are sensitive to noise. But keeping the windows closed blocked out most of the noise for me. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trevi-tastic”
Reviews.Author: cycling
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Ciampioni airport and then got the Ryan air bus (£5 each) to the Termini in Rome. Went straight onto the Metro A line to Barberini which was our closest stop (5 minute quick walk). Then headed straight to the Trevi Fountain which our hotel looked over. Location is unbeleivably perfect and extremely romantic. Rooms were large and newly fitted. Huge King Size comfortable beds/large LCD TV/Wi -fi subject to fee. Great shower again all modern and sparkly clean. Our room faced the front of the hotel on the first floor , the double glazing kept the majority of noise out, which was a good job considering you are right next to one of the busiest and beautifully classy attractions in Rome.... although a van that comes round once early morning (8am ish) and once late at night (12am ish) and picks up all the bottles for recycling will certainly wake you if you are a light sleeper like me. Also heard some early morning stomping from the room above (the lamenated flooring doesn't help), a deep pile carpet on all the floors above would alleviate this, which is the only downside. Because of the comfort and positioning of this hotel you must allow for these small annoyances and we loved being in the heart of rome. We had breakfast in the restaurant on the roof terace which looked over part of the fountain...breathtakingly romantic. Breakfast was very good and alot more varied than the usual european style ham, cheese and toast. And the staff very friendly, especially the receptionists. We would highly recommend this hotel as its nearly perfect !! Hope you all enjoy Rome as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlettroseWirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel in August .We travelled as a family of four and occupied two rooms,both rooms clean and sattisfactory.Location,due to popularity of Fountain located in one of the smallest squares very overcrowded,noisy and lots of agressive selling to tourists but due to Hotel having a Roof Terrace bar and restaurant we thought we could escape the crowds and people watch of an evening after a days sightseeing,no such luck!I had read previous reviews that had mentioned (door locked to roof terrace,not allowed to use regardless of pleading with management)and thought it was a one off experience,but sadly for our three night stay and after asking management who rudely declared it was a holiday that he would not be opening the Terrace before dismissing us .we resigned ourselves to battling crowds and sitting in the Square,the only time the terrace was open, was for breakfast which after the first mornings dissapointment we ate elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the service was disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: andreacrane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my friend and my thirteen year old daughter. It was my daughters first trip to Rome and I wanted to make it special. Although normally a bargain hunter when it comes to hotels, I decided to treat her to two nights in The Relais di Fontana at 265 euros per night. I basically chose this hotel because of the location and the fact that it advertised a terrace overlooking the Trevi Fountain. When we arrived at the hotel we fell in love with the location, which was literally thirty metres away from the fountain. The street itself was busy, with cafes, ice cream parlours and souvenir shops. The atmosphere was vibrant and we loved it. No problem for us to climb the stairs, but those with mobility problems may struggle. The female receptionist was polite and professional. We had booked a triple room after seeing a photo on the hotel website of a nice large room with three beds. We were disappointed to find that our room although large enough had only a large king size bed and a sofa bed. We found the main bed quite comfortable but the sofa bed was springy and uncomfortable. We did not want to start our trip in Rome by making a fuss so we let it go. The room was, however, clean and nicely decorated. The air conditioning worked well and there was a large flat screen TV in the room. The booking confirmation also stated that the price included the mini bar - but dont be fooled as this actually included two bottles of water. Basic coffee facilities were in the room. The bathroom was brightly decorated and the hotel provided the usual toiletries. Fresh fluffy towels were provided each day and the beds were made up every afternoon. The macerator toilet and shower system were noisy, but no big problem. The main issues we had with this hotel was the fact that on both evenings the terrace was closed and the attitude of the staff, in particular the manager. The hotel had advertised the location and its terrace overlooking the fountain as its main features and in all honesty, the thought of watching the sun go down overlooking the Trevi Fountain with a glass of Italian wine, had forced my hand in booking the hotel. The first evening I asked the young male receptionist why it was not open. Although, his English previously had been very good, he appeared all of a sudden to struggle. I was told that the bar man was ill and nothing could be done - that was that. He showed no particular concern. The next evening, we went up to the terrace again and it was still closed. The young male on reception was busy trying to sort out problems for another couple so I waited, not wanting to be put off this time . At this point another male came out of the office and I discovered that he was the manager. Another customer from the USA had now come into the reception area and he asked the manager directly if the terrace would be open. The manager replied that the bar man was in hospital and the terrace could not be opened. The other customer, my friend and I, all politely explained that we had chosen the hotel because of the beautiful terrace overlooking the fountain. The managers response was unbelievable. He asked me... "What do you want me to do, the bar man is in hospital" I said.. "Employ someone else or get another member of staff to open the terrace" The other customer explained that he and his wife had been looking forward to spending the evening on the terrace. Ignoring this, the manager then went into detail about how difficult it was in Italy to employ staff etc. etc. I saw that another member of staff was standing near by. He had been friendly, but clearly did not understand the conversation as he was grinning. I suggested to the manager that this staff member could open the terrace for a while and the manager, (who was now acting like Basil from Faulty Towers) started shouting at the poor staff member (Manuel!), saying... "Why are you smiling? They think you can open the terrace. Tell them you can not open the terrace. Stop smiling" I couldn't believe it. After listening to more of the managers reasons for not opening the terrace, the other customer asked the manager to open it himself. Basil was not happy with this and growled ... "Yes. OK. I'll open it for one hour but you have to let me finish my work first". Clearly getting no where and not wanting to get poor Manuel into any further trouble, we declined his ungracious offer and left. This man obviously does not know how to deal with people. We are very polite people and would never dream of making a fuss over nothing. He was extremely rude and really didn't care. If we hadn't been able to laugh about his attitude, I think we would have left the hotel. (and the fact we had my daughter with us and I didn't want to have to find another hotel that evening) Breakfast at the hotel was (because of the location on the terrace ) - delightful. The buffet is adequate. Probably advisable to get there before 10 am as although breakfast is advertised from 7.30 - 10.30 am this was not the case. We went up at 9.30 and enjoyed the stunning view with a satisfactory, continental breakfast. At 10am my daughter went to refill her juice glass and was told it had all gone. Weird! Anyway, nothing can detract from the lovely terrace area overlooking the Trevi Fountain. A great way to start your day in Rome. The hotel location is brilliant. The Spanish Steps is a ten minute walk away, as is the Pantheon. The Colosseum was about a thirty minute walk (but we took our time) and the Vatican is about 45 minutes. We really enjoyed walking and came across some amazing places en route. There are actually many hotels in the area to choose from. Personally, I would choose another one next time. (simply because of how our problem was dealt with). This hotel is a good choice, with the only main problem, being the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: PNG
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel without the benefit if seeing reviews as it is very new and was a little anxious but it really could not have been better. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was lovely, spacious and very clean. The room was well serviced every day. We travelled with a baby and a small child and the hotel could not have been more helpful. I brought frozen meals for my baby son and the hotel was happy to store them in the freezer and reheat them when asked. The only slight drawback was the lack of a lift connecting the ground floor to reception but staff were always on hand to help lift buggies up the stairs so this really was not a problem. The breakfast terrace has a good view of the Trevi fountain and the rooms are well soundproofed which is important in this very busy area. The location is central and we were able to walk to all main attractions with ease. i would recommend this hotel to anyone (except perhaps those with a mobility problem due to the lack of lift). It was well priced for central Rome and an ideal base for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leo82
Reviews.Content: A perfect location!! The Trevi Fountain is literally JUST outside the entrance and the Spanish Steps, shopping, and great restaurants are only a 5 min walk away! The hotel room was beautiful AND spacious, exceeding our expectations - but what REALLY made us love this hotel was the fantastic service. All of the staff are friendly, speak English very well, and are eager to make your stay perfect - event recommending restaurants, giving directions, and helping us with our Italian phrases. The rooftop breakfast patio is beautiful - with the best view of the Trevi! We will absolutely stay here during our next visit to Rome!

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Fontana Di Trevi
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Lavatore 44, 00187 Rome, Italy
